content.question: Suppose nominal <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="$25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, the price level is <math alttext="1.25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the money supply is <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million. What is real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and the velocity of money according to the quantity theory of money?

choices.label: Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="$2.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, and the velocity of money is <math alttext="12.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>12.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="$10" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, and the velocity of money is <math alttext="20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="$12.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>12.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, and the velocity of money is <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, and the velocity of money is <math alttext="2.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="$25" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, and the velocity of money is <math alttext="8" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>8</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Real <math alttext="G D P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>GDP</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is <math alttext="$20" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> million, and the velocity of money is <math alttext="2.5" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Identify an economic concept, principle, or model using quantitative data or calculations.
